newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer Medica market cap seen 3.0 bln Sfr.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer Medica market cap seen 3.0 bln Sfr.

text.p: Pierre Borgeaud, chairman of the board of Sulzer Technology Corp. said market estimates of the market capitalisation of Sulzer Medica of three billion Swiss francs were a fair esimtes.
"That is a fair estimate," Borgeaud told a news conference, when asked about analysts' views of Medica having a market capitalisation of around three billion francs.
Earlier today Sulzer said it would sell off around 25 percent of its Medica unit sometime this year.
But chief financial officer Erich Mueller said the exact value of Medica would still have to be settled in talks with a bank that would be consulted on the public offering.
Sulzer has not yet decided on which bank should manage the public offering.
"In no way do I want to commit myself to a particular figure," Mueller said.
Mueller said firms' like Medica generally traded at a price-earnings ratio (P/E) of at least 25 or more. The three billion Swiss franc figure was based on that assumption.
"If you take the profit of Medica, then many analysts come up with with a figure of about this size," Mueller said.
